intro: Dischidia major, commonly known as the giant rat's tail plant, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its unique feature is the presence of aerial roots that allow it to climb and anchor itself to trees or other structures. Dischidia major is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in warm, humid environments.
